name: 4-(4-methoxybenzylidene)-2-phenyl-1,3-oxazol-5(4H)-one
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-3922
Reason: 1,3-oxazole ring with a melting point around 106°C. The methoxybenzylidene group introduces a rigid structure with increased molecular weight, estimated at around +20°C. The methoxy group within the oxazole ring introduces additional hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +10°C. The phenyl group introduces additional pi-pi interactions and rigidity, estimated at around +20°C. The carbonyl group introduces additional rigid structures and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +10°C. The methoxy group within the oxazole ring introduces additional hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +10°C.
